lines.text: And what's the point of a revolution without general copulation?
To me, the only reality is imagination; the world inside myself. The revolution no longer interests me.

[simultaneously]
Marat, we're poor. And the poor stay poor.
Now, your enemies fall / We're beheading them all / Duperret and Corday executed in the same old way.
Crucifiction, all good Christians know, is the most sympathetic way to go.
The revolution came and went, And unrest was replaced by discontent.

Man has given a false importance to death. Any animal, man or plant that dies adds to Nature's compost heap becomes the manure without which nothing could grow, nothing could be created. Death is simply part of the process. Every death, even the cruellest death drowns in the total indifference of Nature. Nature would watch unmoved if we destroyed the entire human race. I hate Nature!
